intro: Nephrodium abruptum, commonly known as the abrupt fern, is a rare and delicate plant species belonging to the family Nephrodiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, clustered growth pattern and its small, leathery leaves that are often arranged in a spiral. The plant produces tiny, spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically located on the underside of its fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Nephrodium abruptum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
